description: Returns information about a specific job including shipping information, job status, and other important metadata.

parameters.name: JobId
parameters.description: The automatically generated ID for a job, for example JID123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000.

nested_items.name: JobMetadata
nested_items.description: Information about a specific job, including shipping information, job status, and other important metadata.

nested_items.name: JobId
nested_items.description: The automatically generated ID for a job, for example JID123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000.

nested_items.name: JobState
nested_items.description: The current status of the jobs.

nested_items.name: JobType
nested_items.description: The type of job.

nested_items.name: SnowballType
nested_items.description: The type of device used with this job.

nested_items.name: CreationDate
nested_items.description: The creation date for this job.

nested_items.name: Resources
nested_items.description: An array of S3Resource objects. Each S3Resource object represents an Amazon S3 bucket that your transferred data will be exported from or imported into.

nested_items.name: S3Resources
nested_items.description: An array of S3Resource objects.

nested_items.name: BucketArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: BeginMarker
nested_items.description: The key that starts an optional key range for an export job. Ranges are inclusive and UTF-8 binary sorted.

nested_items.name: EndMarker
nested_items.description: The key that ends an optional key range for an export job. Ranges are inclusive and UTF-8 binary sorted.

nested_items.name: TargetOnDeviceServices
nested_items.description: Specifies the service or services on the Snow Family device that your transferred data will be exported from or imported into. Amazon Web Services Snow Family supports Amazon S3 and NFS (Network File System).

nested_items.name: ServiceName
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the service on the Snow Family device that your transferred data will be exported from or imported into.

nested_items.name: TransferOption
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the data is being imported or exported. You can import or export the data, or use it locally on the device.

nested_items.name: LambdaResources
nested_items.description: The Python-language Lambda functions for this job.

nested_items.name: LambdaArn
nested_items.description: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that represents an Lambda function to be triggered by PUT object actions on the associated local Amazon S3 resource.

nested_items.name: EventTriggers
nested_items.description: The array of ARNs for  S3Resource objects to trigger the  LambdaResource objects associated with this job.

nested_items.name: EventResourceARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for any local Amazon S3 resource that is an Lambda function's event trigger associated with this job.

nested_items.name: Ec2AmiResources
nested_items.description: The Amazon Machine Images (AMIs) associated with this job.

nested_items.name: AmiId
nested_items.description: The ID of the AMI in Amazon EC2.

nested_items.name: SnowballAmiId
nested_items.description: The ID of the AMI on the Snow device.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description of the job, provided at job creation.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the Key Management Service (KMS) key associated with this job. This ARN was created using the CreateKey API action in KMS.

nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: The role ARN associated with this job. This ARN was created using the CreateRole API action in Identity and Access Management.

nested_items.name: AddressId
nested_items.description: The ID for the address that you want the Snow device shipped to.

nested_items.name: ShippingDetails
nested_items.description: A job's shipping information, including inbound and outbound tracking numbers and shipping speed options.

nested_items.name: ShippingOption
nested_items.description: The shipping speed for a particular job. This speed doesn't dictate how soon you'll get the Snow device from the job's creation date. This speed represents how quickly it moves to its destination while in transit. Regional shipping speeds are as follows:
In Australia, you have access to express shipping. Typically, Snow devices shipped express are delivered in about a day.

In the European Union (EU), you have access to express shipping. Typically, Snow devices shipped express are delivered in about a day. In addition, most countries in the EU have access to standard shipping, which typically takes less than a week, one way.
In India, Snow devices are delivered in one to seven days.
In the United States of America (US), you have access to one-day shipping and two-day shipping.

nested_items.name: InboundShipment
nested_items.description: The Status and TrackingNumber values for a Snow device being returned to Amazon Web Services for a particular job.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Status information for a shipment.

nested_items.name: TrackingNumber
nested_items.description: The tracking number for this job. Using this tracking number with your region's carrier's website, you can track a Snow device as the carrier transports it.

nested_items.name: OutboundShipment
nested_items.description: The Status and TrackingNumber values for a Snow device being delivered to the address that you specified for a particular job.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Status information for a shipment.

nested_items.name: TrackingNumber
nested_items.description: The tracking number for this job. Using this tracking number with your region's carrier's website, you can track a Snow device as the carrier transports it.

nested_items.name: SnowballCapacityPreference
nested_items.description: The Snow device capacity preference for this job, specified at job creation. In US regions, you can choose between 50 TB and 80 TB Snowballs. All other regions use 80 TB capacity Snowballs.

nested_items.name: Notification
nested_items.description: The Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) notification settings associated with a specific job. The Notification object is returned as a part of the response syntax of the DescribeJob action in the JobMetadata data type.

nested_items.name: SnsTopicARN
nested_items.description: The new SNS TopicArn that you want to associate with this job. You can create Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) for topics by using the CreateTopic Amazon SNS API action.

nested_items.name: JobStatesToNotify
nested_items.description: The list of job states that will trigger a notification for this job.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: NotifyAll
nested_items.description: Any change in job state will trigger a notification for this job.

nested_items.name: DevicePickupSnsTopicARN
nested_items.description: Used to send SNS notifications for the person picking up the device (identified during job creation).

nested_items.name: DataTransferProgress
nested_items.description: A value that defines the real-time status of a Snow device's data transfer while the device is at Amazon Web Services. This data is only available while a job has a JobState value of InProgress, for both import and export jobs.

nested_items.name: BytesTransferred
nested_items.description: The number of bytes transferred between a Snow device and Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: ObjectsTransferred
nested_items.description: The number of objects transferred between a Snow device and Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: TotalBytes
nested_items.description: The total bytes of data for a transfer between a Snow device and Amazon S3. This value is set to 0 (zero) until all the keys that will be transferred have been listed.

nested_items.name: TotalObjects
nested_items.description: The total number of objects for a transfer between a Snow device and Amazon S3. This value is set to 0 (zero) until all the keys that will be transferred have been listed.

nested_items.name: JobLogInfo
nested_items.description: Links to Amazon S3 presigned URLs for the job report and logs. For import jobs, the PDF job report becomes available at the end of the import process. For export jobs, your job report typically becomes available while the Snow device for your job part is being delivered to you.

nested_items.name: JobCompletionReportURI
nested_items.description: A link to an Amazon S3 presigned URL where the job completion report is located.

nested_items.name: JobSuccessLogURI
nested_items.description: A link to an Amazon S3 presigned URL where the job success log is located.

nested_items.name: JobFailureLogURI
nested_items.description: A link to an Amazon S3 presigned URL where the job failure log is located.

nested_items.name: ClusterId
nested_items.description: The 39-character ID for the cluster, for example CID123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000.

nested_items.name: ForwardingAddressId
nested_items.description: The ID of the address that you want a job shipped to, after it will be shipped to its primary address. This field is not supported in most regions.

nested_items.name: TaxDocuments
nested_items.description: The metadata associated with the tax documents required in your Amazon Web Services Region.

nested_items.name: GSTIN
nested_items.description: The Goods and Services Tax (GST) documents required in Amazon Web Services Region in India.

nested_items.name: DeviceConfiguration
nested_items.description: The container for SnowconeDeviceConfiguration.

nested_items.name: SnowconeDeviceConfiguration
nested_items.description: Returns information about the device configuration for an Snowcone job.

nested_items.name: WirelessConnection
nested_items.description: Configures the wireless connection for the Snowcone device.

nested_items.name: IsWifiEnabled
nested_items.description: Enables the Wi-Fi adapter on an Snowcone device.

nested_items.name: RemoteManagement
nested_items.description: Allows you to securely operate and manage Snowcone devices remotely from outside of your internal network. When set to INSTALLED_AUTOSTART, remote management will automatically be available when the device arrives at your location. Otherwise, you need to use the Snowball Client to manage the device.

nested_items.name: LongTermPricingId
nested_items.description: The ID of the long-term pricing type for the device.

nested_items.name: OnDeviceServiceConfiguration
nested_items.description: Represents metadata and configuration settings for services on an Amazon Web Services Snow Family device.

nested_items.name: NFSOnDeviceService
nested_items.description: Represents the NFS (Network File System) service on a Snow Family device.

nested_items.name: StorageLimit
nested_items.description: The maximum NFS storage for one Snow Family device.

nested_items.name: StorageUnit
nested_items.description: The scale unit of the NFS storage on the device.

nested_items.name: TGWOnDeviceService
nested_items.description: Represents the Storage Gateway service Tape Gateway type on a Snow Family device.

nested_items.name: StorageLimit
nested_items.description: The maximum number of virtual tapes to store on one Snow Family device. Due to physical resource limitations, this value must be set to 80 for Snowball Edge.

nested_items.name: StorageUnit
nested_items.description: The scale unit of the virtual tapes on the device.

nested_items.name: EKSOnDeviceService
nested_items.description: The configuration of EKS Anywhere on the Snow Family device.

nested_items.name: KubernetesVersion
nested_items.description: The Kubernetes version for EKS Anywhere on the Snow Family device.

nested_items.name: EKSAnywhereVersion
nested_items.description: The optional version of EKS Anywhere on the Snow Family device.

nested_items.name: S3OnDeviceService
nested_items.description: Configuration for Amazon S3 compatible storage on Snow family devices.

nested_items.name: StorageLimit
nested_items.description: If the specified storage limit value matches storage limit of one of the defined configurations, that configuration will be used. If the specified storage limit value does not match any defined configuration, the request will fail. If more than one configuration has the same storage limit as specified, the other input need to be provided.

nested_items.name: StorageUnit
nested_items.description: Storage unit. Currently the only supported unit is TB.

nested_items.name: ServiceSize
nested_items.description: Applicable when creating a cluster. Specifies how many nodes are needed for Amazon S3 compatible storage on Snow family devices. If specified, the other input can be omitted.

nested_items.name: FaultTolerance
nested_items.description: >Fault tolerance level of the cluster. This indicates the number of nodes that can go down without degrading the performance of the cluster. This additional input helps when the specified StorageLimit matches more than one Amazon S3 compatible storage on Snow family devices service configuration.

nested_items.name: ImpactLevel
nested_items.description: The highest impact level of data that will be stored or processed on the device, provided at job creation.

nested_items.name: PickupDetails
nested_items.description: Information identifying the person picking up the device.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the person picking up the device.

nested_items.name: PhoneNumber
nested_items.description: The phone number of the person picking up the device.

nested_items.name: Email
nested_items.description: The email address of the person picking up the device.

nested_items.name: IdentificationNumber
nested_items.description: The number on the credential identifying the person picking up the device.

nested_items.name: IdentificationExpirationDate
nested_items.description: Expiration date of the credential identifying the person picking up the device.

nested_items.name: IdentificationIssuingOrg
nested_items.description: Organization that issued the credential identifying the person picking up the device.

nested_items.name: DevicePickupId
nested_items.description: The unique ID for a device that will be picked up.

nested_items.name: SnowballId
nested_items.description: Unique ID associated with a device.

nested_items.name: SubJobMetadata
nested_items.description: Information about a specific job part (in the case of an export job), including shipping information, job status, and other important metadata.

nested_items.name: JobId
nested_items.description: The automatically generated ID for a job, for example JID123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000.

nested_items.name: JobState
nested_items.description: The current status of the jobs.

nested_items.name: JobType
nested_items.description: The type of job.

nested_items.name: SnowballType
nested_items.description: The type of device used with this job.

nested_items.name: CreationDate
nested_items.description: The creation date for this job.

nested_items.name: Resources
nested_items.description: An array of S3Resource objects. Each S3Resource object represents an Amazon S3 bucket that your transferred data will be exported from or imported into.

nested_items.description: An array of S3Resource objects.

nested_items.name: BucketArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: ServiceName
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the service on the Snow Family device that your transferred data will be exported from or imported into.

nested_items.name: TransferOption
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the data is being imported or exported. You can import or export the data, or use it locally on the device.

nested_items.description: The Python-language Lambda functions for this job.

nested_items.description: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that represents an Lambda function to be triggered by PUT object actions on the associated local Amazon S3 resource.

nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for any local Amazon S3 resource that is an Lambda function's event trigger associated with this job.

nested_items.name: Ec2AmiResources
nested_items.description: The Amazon Machine Images (AMIs) associated with this job.

nested_items.name: AmiId
nested_items.description: The ID of the AMI in Amazon EC2.

nested_items.name: SnowballAmiId
nested_items.description: The ID of the AMI on the Snow device.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description of the job, provided at job creation.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the Key Management Service (KMS) key associated with this job. This ARN was created using the CreateKey API action in KMS.

nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: The role ARN associated with this job. This ARN was created using the CreateRole API action in Identity and Access Management.

nested_items.name: AddressId
nested_items.description: The ID for the address that you want the Snow device shipped to.

nested_items.name: ShippingDetails
nested_items.description: A job's shipping information, including inbound and outbound tracking numbers and shipping speed options.

nested_items.name: ShippingOption
nested_items.description: The shipping speed for a particular job. This speed doesn't dictate how soon you'll get the Snow device from the job's creation date. This speed represents how quickly it moves to its destination while in transit. Regional shipping speeds are as follows:
In Australia, you have access to express shipping. Typically, Snow devices shipped express are delivered in about a day.

In the European Union (EU), you have access to express shipping. Typically, Snow devices shipped express are delivered in about a day. In addition, most countries in the EU have access to standard shipping, which typically takes less than a week, one way.
In India, Snow devices are delivered in one to seven days.
In the United States of America (US), you have access to one-day shipping and two-day shipping.

nested_items.description: The Snow device capacity preference for this job, specified at job creation. In US regions, you can choose between 50 TB and 80 TB Snowballs. All other regions use 80 TB capacity Snowballs.

nested_items.description: The Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) notification settings associated with a specific job. The Notification object is returned as a part of the response syntax of the DescribeJob action in the JobMetadata data type.

nested_items.description: The new SNS TopicArn that you want to associate with this job. You can create Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) for topics by using the CreateTopic Amazon SNS API action.

nested_items.name: JobStatesToNotify
nested_items.description: The list of job states that will trigger a notification for this job.
(string) ---

nested_items.description: Any change in job state will trigger a notification for this job.

nested_items.name: DevicePickupSnsTopicARN
nested_items.description: Used to send SNS notifications for the person picking up the device (identified during job creation).

nested_items.name: DataTransferProgress
nested_items.description: A value that defines the real-time status of a Snow device's data transfer while the device is at Amazon Web Services. This data is only available while a job has a JobState value of InProgress, for both import and export jobs.

nested_items.name: BytesTransferred
nested_items.description: The number of bytes transferred between a Snow device and Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: ObjectsTransferred
nested_items.description: The number of objects transferred between a Snow device and Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: TotalBytes
nested_items.description: The total bytes of data for a transfer between a Snow device and Amazon S3. This value is set to 0 (zero) until all the keys that will be transferred have been listed.

nested_items.name: TotalObjects
nested_items.description: The total number of objects for a transfer between a Snow device and Amazon S3. This value is set to 0 (zero) until all the keys that will be transferred have been listed.

nested_items.name: JobLogInfo
nested_items.description: Links to Amazon S3 presigned URLs for the job report and logs. For import jobs, the PDF job report becomes available at the end of the import process. For export jobs, your job report typically becomes available while the Snow device for your job part is being delivered to you.

nested_items.name: JobCompletionReportURI
nested_items.description: A link to an Amazon S3 presigned URL where the job completion report is located.

nested_items.name: JobSuccessLogURI
nested_items.description: A link to an Amazon S3 presigned URL where the job success log is located.

nested_items.name: JobFailureLogURI
nested_items.description: A link to an Amazon S3 presigned URL where the job failure log is located.

nested_items.name: ClusterId
nested_items.description: The 39-character ID for the cluster, for example CID123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000.

nested_items.name: ForwardingAddressId
nested_items.description: The ID of the address that you want a job shipped to, after it will be shipped to its primary address. This field is not supported in most regions.

nested_items.name: TaxDocuments
nested_items.description: The metadata associated with the tax documents required in your Amazon Web Services Region.

nested_items.name: GSTIN
nested_items.description: The Goods and Services Tax (GST) documents required in Amazon Web Services Region in India.

nested_items.name: DeviceConfiguration
nested_items.description: The container for SnowconeDeviceConfiguration.

nested_items.name: SnowconeDeviceConfiguration
nested_items.description: Returns information about the device configuration for an Snowcone job.

nested_items.name: WirelessConnection
nested_items.description: Configures the wireless connection for the Snowcone device.

nested_items.name: IsWifiEnabled
nested_items.description: Enables the Wi-Fi adapter on an Snowcone device.

nested_items.name: RemoteManagement
nested_items.description: Allows you to securely operate and manage Snowcone devices remotely from outside of your internal network. When set to INSTALLED_AUTOSTART, remote management will automatically be available when the device arrives at your location. Otherwise, you need to use the Snowball Client to manage the device.
